name: Trianon Bonita Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Trianon Hotel is situated in a quiet, upmarket location, adjacent to a small, but smart, shopping mall which included a couple of places to eat.
reviews.title: A comfortable, pretty base from which to explore.

likes.disliked: — Noise from elevator in our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfortable with a Tempur bed and a lovely view over the gardens and small lake where there was always wildlife to watch.
reviews.title: very comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Although the bottom half of our bathroom door needed a wipe over, the rest of our room was very clean and pleasant.
reviews.title: Beware of their Lakehouse restaurant

likes.liked: — Price and the building and grounds

reviews.text: The patio, garden, pool area and pool bar overlooked the lake and were quiet and restful.
reviews.title: Good structure but urgently needs direction and new mangement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was very handy and adequate.
reviews.title: Trianon Bonita Bay Review

likes.liked: — The outdoor area - pool and landscaping/ the outdoor mall within walking distance
likes.disliked: — Sad continental breakfast, terrible linens pillows mattress and furnishings; absolutely everything in the room needs updating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at The Trianon on Christmas night (we were in Bonita Springs to visit family) and were delighted with our huge lakefront room with balcony. Although we had read many good reviews of the hotel, it definitely exceeded all expectations. The room was tastefully furnished in traditional style and was bright and welcoming. Beds were very comfortable and we had plenty of space to unpack and settle in for 5 nights. The bathroom was large too, with walk in shower and bathtub and everywhere was spotlessly clean. Everything about the Trianon makes you feell that its management really cares. The staff were friendly and helpful and we liked the intimate atmosphere of the bar area and the tropical terrace overlooking the lake, where yoiu can see alligators swimming. The recently opened lakeside pavilion restaurant is a good place for a casual meal. Location is great too as there is a small exclusive shopping mall with nice bars and restaurants next door and plenty of good fish restaurants nearby on the main road. The main thing this hotel has got going for it (apart from good facilities and comfort) is charm - something you cannot typically find in an American chain hotel. It is priced similarly to some of the more ordinary ones, yet it was of a far superior quality. We went out for a great Christmas dinner at the nearby Ritz Carlton but I would choose the Trianon over its more glitzy neighbours every time.
reviews.title: Excellent value and quality that exceeded all expectations!

likes.liked: — Comfortable, friendly, good atmosphere, good service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had seen previous good reviews for this hotel but because of its cheapness in the Virgin brochure, I was still unsure. The whole time I was there I kept wondering what the catch was. there was none. The room was large and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was excellent with a huge walk-in shower. We had a superb view over the lake. Breakfast was adequate - it was free after all! Its location was ideal being only a matter of yards from a good quality shopping centre with a variety of restaurants. The beach could be reached within 10 minutes. The only shortcomming that I could see was that the pool was rather small with minimal shade and few sun umbrellas. (We prefer the beach anyway). Overall outstanding value.
reviews.title: What is the catch?

reviews.text: This place is alright. It was convenient to an event that required us to be in Naples. They have Temperpedic beds that some of us liked but they gave me a back ache. They are hard and hot! A/C was SO loud it woke me up every time it kicked on! The bathrooms were not clean. The grout in the tiles were disgusting. The shower stinks. I think it was the water but it was hard to take when you step into the shower! The rooms are tired, worn and very dark! Only lighting is from a few lamps. They have a continental breakfast that is included. (Cereal, bread, bananas and coffee.) We got the room for $100/night so I guess you can't expect too much. There is a neat shopping area across from the hotel that has some upscale stores and good restaurants. Across Tamiami Rd. there is a grocery store called Fresh Market that is similar to Whole Foods or Central Market that has nice wines, gourmet cheeses, coffees, sandwiches, fruit etc. Very convenient since there is a good sized compact refrigerator in the room. Coffee maker in bathroom (buy your own coffee) Balcony on lake side has a nice view but don't expect much from this hotel. There are 2 Ritz-Carlton's close by so don't stay here if you want something nice!
reviews.title: Tired Trianon

likes.liked: — In room refigerator came in very handy
likes.disliked: — Dirty, Dark, Rude front desk and housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and bathroom were nice and big. The bed was very comfortable. The continental breakfast was nice to eat out on the viranda. Overall we had a great experience!
reviews.title: Great Stay!
Can't Wait To Go Back..
reviews.text: Just came home from the most wonderful 10 night stay at this hotel. The rooms are large, the bathrooms are very big and very clean and the beds are so comfortable that you could stay there all day! Located very convieniently for beaches, lots of malls and nearby towns. Very good value for money. The only drawback was the bad internet connection in the room, still, when on holiday no-one should be near a computer!! Watching the alligators in the lake whilst eating at the grill bar was quite an attraction. The continental breakfast was basic but who cares when there are so many good eateries around town. No-body is ever going to go hungry in USA are they? Wonderful to have an airport so nearby too so the trip home is not too painful. Can't wait to go back there.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: Have just returned from a wonderful 2 week holiday at the Trianon hotel. The hotel is in the beautiful location of Bonita Springs, a few miles north of Naples. The rooms were large with very good sized bathrooms. Breakfast is complementary and can be taken inside or on the terrace which overlooks a lake. Will definitely return to this hotel again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Felt I had to comment after reading the review from May 2007. We stayed at this hotel for one night on a road trip in September 2007. Booked through Hotwire. The hotel was gorgeous, lovely and quiet, fantastic pool and outside areas, even saw the alligator in the lake at the back of the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.disliked: — The alligator behind me when I was in the Jacuzzi!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought the bathroom was great, separate shower, bath, nice and clean and very big. Mattresses are Temper-pedic (memory foam) and would take a bit of getting used to, but still slept very well. Room was clean and ours wasn't dark.
reviews.title: Tired and tattered

reviews.text: Reception staff were very pleasant and valet was very helpful.
reviews.title: a fantastic return

likes.liked: — the peace and quiet and lovely lakeside setting
likes.disliked: — room cleaners never replied when you spoke to them !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I understand if someone has had a bad experience but we didn't and I would have no hesitation in returning to Trianon. Don't let one bad review put you off (especially if you book through Hotwire for fantastic deals, take a chance it will be worth it).
reviews.title: excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so impressed when we stayed at this hotel last January that we booked again this year. They have added a nice hot tub and bar/grill.
reviews.title: Second visit from the UK

likes.liked: — The huge room and enormous bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very well appointed and comfortable.The staff are very helpful and polite.
reviews.title: Great Time

likes.disliked: — not much on the entertainment side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One tip when checking in,always ask for a room that is nowhere near the lifts or ice machines then you will have a very quiet stay(that rule applies to most hotels anyway)
reviews.title: Don't book if you want to use your laptop!

reviews.text: Just one point that we also made last year.The coffee at breakfast is awful. In the rooms they have Wolfgang Puck and that is quite strong but at breakfast it is more like the water they wash the dishes in!!
reviews.title: Out of Africa in Florida!

reviews.text: May even be back in 2008
reviews.title: lovely quiet location

aka: Trianon Bonita Bay Hotel Bonita Springs
description: Generously sized rooms, Tempurpedic mattresses, including non-smoking feature full shower/separate tub, free wi-fi. Continental breakfast included. Swimming Pool & Jacuzzi and Fitness Center. Our picturesque grounds include meeting facilities and Lakehouse Bar & Grill. 24-hour front desk provides concierge services. Promenade Center adjacent featuring upscale restaurants and shopping. Local beaches are minutes away and short driving distance to FGCU, SWFL Airport, Germain Arena, Coconut Point Mall and attractions of Naples, Florida.
